meanings.definition: A soothing song sung to children to help them fall asleep.
meanings.sent1: The mother sang a lullaby to her baby every night.
meanings.sent2: The soft lullaby filled the nursery with a calming melody.
meanings.sent3: The lullaby was so effective that even the family cat dozed off.
meanings.sent4: The lullaby wrapped the room in a blanket of tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The gentle lullaby whispered sweet dreams into the child's ears.

meanings.definition: To sing a lullaby to someone.
meanings.sent1: She would lullaby her little sister to sleep with a beautiful tune.
meanings.sent2: He decided to lullaby the baby to sleep with a soft melody.
meanings.sent3: The siblings took turns lullabying each other during their sleepover.
meanings.sent4: Her voice lullabied him into a peaceful slumber.
meanings.sent5: The singer lullabied the audience into a state of relaxation with her performance.
